quiz.question: What is the common saying about risk and return?
options: The lower the risk, the higher the return
The higher the risk, the higher the possible return
Risk and return are not related
High risk always means you will lose money
quiz.answer: The higher the risk, the higher the possible return

quiz.question: What level of risk does saving in a bank account have?
options: High risk
Medium risk
No risk
It depends on the bank
quiz.answer: No risk

quiz.question: What is an important question to ask before making a high-risk investment?
options: Will this make me rich tomorrow?
Can I afford to lose all my investment?
Do my friends think this is cool?
Is the company logo nice?
quiz.answer: Can I afford to lose all my investment?

quiz.question: What is a 'savings goal'?
options: Something you get for free
A football goal made of money
Something you want but have to work and save for
Money you find on the street
quiz.answer: Something you want but have to work and save for

quiz.question: What does it mean for a savings goal to be 'realistic'?
options: It is something you can achieve in a reasonable amount of time
It is something that is very expensive and will take 50 years
It is something your parents will buy for you
It is something you see in a dream
quiz.answer: It is something you can achieve in a reasonable amount of time

quiz.question: What is the simple definition of 'compound interest'?
options: Interest that is simple
Interest on interest
A type of bank account
Money you pay to the bank
quiz.answer: Interest on interest

quiz.question: Does compound interest make your money grow faster or slower than simple interest?
options: Slower
Faster
At the same rate
It doesn't grow
quiz.answer: Faster

quiz.question: What is inflation?
options: When a balloon gets bigger
When prices of items get bigger or increase
When you get more pocket money
When things get cheaper
quiz.answer: When prices of items get bigger or increase

quiz.question: If inflation happens, what happens to your money?
options: It buys you more things
It loses value, and buys you less
The coins get bigger
Nothing happens
quiz.answer: It loses value, and buys you less

kids.title: How to Help Kids Save Money?

quiz.question: What is 'income'?
options: Money that goes out for bills
Money that comes in from a job
Money for video games
Money you find
quiz.answer: Money that comes in from a job

quiz.question: What are 'expenses'?
options: Money you get as a gift
Money that you save
Money that goes out for things you need and want
Money that comes from the government
quiz.answer: Money that goes out for things you need and want

quiz.question: What does it mean to 'earn' money?
options: To find it on the street
To do work in return for payment
To get it for your birthday
To ask your parents for it
quiz.answer: To do work in return for payment

quiz.question: What is a 'salary'?
options: A type of vegetable
Money you get paid per hour
Working a certain number of hours for a set amount of pay
Money you only get once a year
quiz.answer: Working a certain number of hours for a set amount of pay

quiz.question: When you use a credit card, are you spending your own money or borrowing money?
options: Your own money
Your parents' money
Borrowing money
It's free money
quiz.answer: Borrowing money

quiz.question: What happens if you don't pay the full bill at the end of the month?
options: Nothing happens
You get more money
The company charges you interest
The card stops working forever
quiz.answer: The company charges you interest

quiz.question: What is 'gross pay'?
options: The money you actually receive
The total amount paid BEFORE deductions
The money the government takes
An extra payment for travel
quiz.answer: The total amount paid BEFORE deductions

quiz.question: What is 'net pay'?
options: The total amount paid before deductions
The money you have to give back
The actual amount of money you receive AFTER deductions
The money you donate to charity
quiz.answer: The actual amount of money you receive AFTER deductions

quiz.question: What are the two main types of bank accounts?
options: Money accounts and card accounts
Current accounts and savings accounts
Big accounts and small accounts
Old accounts and new accounts
quiz.answer: Current accounts and savings accounts

quiz.question: What is 'interest' in a savings account?
options: A fee you have to pay
Money the bank gives you for saving with them
A type of ATM card
Something that is not interesting
quiz.answer: Money the bank gives you for saving with them

quiz.question: What is the initial amount of money you borrow called?
options: The Interest
The Principal
The Return
The Compound
quiz.answer: The Principal

quiz.question: What is the main difference between simple and compound interest?
options: Simple interest is harder to calculate
Compound interest is only for cars
Compound interest is paid on the principal plus accrued interest
Simple interest makes you more money
quiz.answer: Compound interest is paid on the principal plus accrued interest

quiz.question: The 'Rule of 72' helps you estimate how long it will take for an investment to do what?
options: Disappear
Double in value
Become shared with friends
Get taxed
quiz.answer: Double in value

quiz.question: What is the key difference between a debit card and a credit card?
options: A debit card is green, a credit card is blue
A debit card uses your money; a credit card is a loan
A credit card is free money
You can only use debit cards online
quiz.answer: A debit card uses your money; a credit card is a loan

quiz.question: What is 'fiat money' (like the US Dollar)?
options: Money made by a car company
Money that is backed by gold
Money that represents a promise by the government
Money that is only used for video games
quiz.answer: Money that represents a promise by the government

quiz.question: What is a 'nest egg'?
options: A real egg laid by a bird
Money saved up and tucked away
A type of financial scam
A type of loan
quiz.answer: Money saved up and tucked away

quiz.question: What is the fancy term for 'paying for stuff'?
options: Money spending
Financial exchange
Cash transfer
Economic activity
quiz.answer: Financial exchange

quiz.question: What is the main difference between a bank and a credit union?
options: Banks are only for saving, credit unions are for loans
Banks are for-profit, credit unions are not-for-profit
Credit unions have higher fees
Only banks are insured
quiz.answer: Banks are for-profit, credit unions are not-for-profit

quiz.question: What does the FDIC do?
options: It prints money for the government
It insures bank deposits up to $250,000
It gives out loans to everyone
It sets the interest rates for credit cards
quiz.answer: It insures bank deposits up to $250,000

quiz.question: How is your income split in the 50-30-20 rule?
options: 50% Wants, 30% Needs, 20% Savings
50% Needs, 30% Wants, 20% Savings
50% Savings, 30% Wants, 20% Needs
50% Needs, 30% Savings, 20% Wants
quiz.answer: 50% Needs, 30% Wants, 20% Savings

quiz.question: What is an example of a 'Need'?
options: Video games
A vacation
Rent or home payments
Streaming services
quiz.answer: Rent or home payments

quiz.question: What is a 'budget'?
options: A plan to spend all your money on props
A financial plan to keep your income higher than your expenses
A type of savings account
A way to borrow money from friends
quiz.answer: A financial plan to keep your income higher than your expenses

quiz.question: What is one of the best tools for budgeting mentioned in the video?
options: A calculator
A notebook
Spreadsheets
A signed baseball
quiz.answer: Spreadsheets

quiz.question: What does a 'withdrawal history' on a financial statement show?
options: All the times money has entered your account
Your starting and ending balance
All the times money has left your account
Your account number
quiz.answer: All the times money has left your account

quiz.question: What is a benefit of an 'e-statement'?
options: It costs more money
It uses more paper
It is typically free and better for the environment
It arrives in the mail
quiz.answer: It is typically free and better for the environment

quiz.question: What is a 'fixed expense'?
options: An expense that changes every day
An expense for fixing things
An expense that costs about the same amount each time
An expense you don't have to pay
quiz.answer: An expense that costs about the same amount each time

quiz.question: What is one method the video suggests for budgeting a variable expense?
options: Guess a random number
Ask a friend how much they spend
Take the average of what you spent the last few months
Spend as much as you want
quiz.answer: Take the average of what you spent the last few months

quiz.question: What is the first step in envelope budgeting?
options: Label different envelopes with specific expenses
Put all your money in one big envelope
Buy as many envelopes as possible
Mail your money to the bank
quiz.answer: Label different envelopes with specific expenses

quiz.question: What happens to the money left over in an envelope at the end of the month?
options: It disappears
You have to give it back to the bank
It gets added to your savings envelope
You have to spend it immediately
quiz.answer: It gets added to your savings envelope
